entries.title: Microsoft will let companies create their own custom versions of ChatGPT, source says
entries.description: Microsoft is planning to let companies, schools and governments create their own chatbots with OpenAI's ChatGPT for purposes like customer service.

entries.title: Wholesale egg prices have 'collapsed.' Why consumers may soon see relief
entries.description: Wholesale egg prices have declined by over 50% from their recent record highs. Retail prices may soon follow, but that's not a sure thing.

entries.title: Microsoft CEO Nadella calls AI-powered search biggest thing for company since cloud 15 years ago
entries.description: Satya Nadella said AI-powered search is the biggest thing to happen to the company in the nine years he's been CEO

entries.title: New photos show the U.S. Navy recovering downed China spy balloon off U.S. coast
entries.description: A Chinese spy balloon was shot down on orders of President Joe Biden, and his  administration is considering other actions, Sen. Chuck Schumer said.

entries.title: Fed Chief Powell says the disinflationary process has begun, but has a long way to go
entries.description: Fed Chairman Jerome Powell spoke Wednesday in a question-and-answer session at the Economic Club of Washington, D.C.

entries.title: A neuroscientist shares the 4 ‘highly coveted’ skills that set introverts apart: ‘Their brains work differently’
entries.description: Neuroscientist Friederike Fabritius has worked with companies like Google and Deloitte on how to retain top talent. While many leaders prefer to hire extroverts, she says introverts are often more successful at work.

entries.title: Zoom to lay off 1,300 employees, or about 15% of its workforce
entries.description: Zoom on Tuesday announced plans to cut about 1,300 workers, or 15% of its workforce, according to a blog post shared to the company's website.

entries.title: What will TV look like in three years? These industry insiders share their predictions
entries.description: CNBC asked media insiders, including Barry Diller, Bela Bajaria and Bill Simmons, for their predictions about the future of TV.

entries.title: Plant-based salmon startup capitalizes on rising interest in fake seafood
Billionaire Tesla bull Ron Baron says Musk promised him multiples on his $100 million Twitter investment
entries.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk promised billionaire investor Ron Baron two to three times his money when Baron invested in Twitter's take-private deal, Baron said Tuesday.

entries.title: Turkey’s Ceyhan oil port disrupted by weather as earthquake damage assessed
entries.description: Adverse weather conditions are disrupting loadings at Turkey's Ceyhan port, where damage is being assessed in wake of Monday's twin earthquakes.

entries.title: UK PM Rishi Sunak overhauls government departments after bumpy 100 days in power
entries.description: U.K. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak announced a mini overhaul of his government as he seeks to reassert his authority after a shaky first 100 days in office.

entries.title: Mark Mobius: Adani had 'big problems' that put me off, but India still looks appealing
entries.description: The head of Mobius Capital Partners said fraud accusations against Adani should be seen as isolated and wake investors up to the scale of the Indian market.

entries.title: Fed's Neel Kashkari says central bank has not made enough progress, keeping his rate outlook
entries.description: Kashkari told CNBC on Tuesday that he sees the Fed's benchmark interest rate likely heading to about 5.4%.

entries.title: New Western measures aim to turn up the heat on Putin’s oil revenues. Analysts are underwhelmed
entries.description: The West is seeking to deplete Russian President Vladimir Putin's war chest as the Kremlin's nearly year-long war in Ukraine drags on.

entries.title: Turkey's President Erdogan declares 3-month state of emergency for quake-hit regions
entries.description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan declared a three-month state of emergency in 10 of the country's provinces Tuesday.

entries.title: Bill Gates on why he'll carry on using private jets and campaigning on climate change
entries.description: The Microsoft co-founder made his comments during an interview with the BBC.

entries.title: Nintendo cuts sales forecast for its ageing Switch console after disappointing holiday season
entries.description: Nintendo said it now expects to sell 18 million Switch units for the fiscal year ending March 2023, down from a previous forecast of 19 million.

entries.title: 75% of LGBTQ+ startup founders hide their identity from investors, UK survey finds
entries.description: A survey from U.K. LGBTQ+ investor network Proud Ventures found that 75% of LGBTQ+ startup founders and 79% of investors conceal their identity.

entries.title: U.S. is 'absolutely' behind on supply chain independence from China, Biden advisor says
entries.description: For the U.S., whose relations with China can currently be described as tense at best, this poses several potential security risks.

entries.title: SoftBank's Vision Fund posts fourth straight quarter of losses as tech slump hits Japanese giant
entries.description: SoftBank's flagship investment arm, the Vision Fund, has been hit by a slump in technology valuations over the past year.

entries.title: BP posts record 2022 earnings to join Big Oil profit bonanza
entries.description: Oil major BP's record annual profits follow bumper earnings from energy giants Shell, Exxon Mobil and Chevron.

entries.title: French bank BNP Paribas reports bumper profit for 2022, boosts stock purchase plan
entries.description: BNP Paribas reported Tuesday a 7% rise in net income for 2022 and revised up its profit targets.

entries.title: U.S. Treasury bond yields rise — and stock markets fall — on January jobs report
entries.description: January’s U.S. jobs report was so positive that Treasury yields rose and markets fell. Their trajectory for the rest of the week depends on Fed Chair Powell.

entries.title: India will buy oil from 'wherever we have to' if terms are beneficial, energy minister says
entries.description: India will secure oil from anywhere as long as the terms are beneficial, India's energy minister Hardeep Singh Puri told CNBC.

entries.title: Baidu leaps to 11-month high as it reveals plan to launch ChatGPT-style 'Ernie Bot'
entries.description: Shares of Baidu jumped more than 13% in Hong Kong as the company said it will launch its own artificial intelligence chatbot.

entries.title: 'The worst is over': Tech investors are bullish on investing in China again
entries.description: Tech investors share an optimistic outlook on investing in China again, but investors realized that they cannot put all of their eggs in one basket.

entries.title: There isn't enough copper in the world — and the shortage could last till 2030
entries.description: A copper deficit is set to inundate global markets throughout 2023, fueled by increasingly challenged South American supply streams and higher demand pressures.

entries.title: Google announces Bard A.I. in response to ChatGPT
entries.description: Google Bard comes as the company tries to compete with the popularity of ChatGPT.

entries.title: The next 'White Lotus' is expected to be filmed in one of these locations in Asia
entries.description: HBO smash hit "The White Lotus" led to soaring travel interest in its previous filming locations, Hawaii and Sicily. Now all eyes are on Asia for season three.
